Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek ostracon
Description: This Greek ostracon dated to the year 31 of the reign of the emperor Augustus (the year 1-2 of our era) constitutes a receipt of payment of the "balaneutikon" tax, which served to maintain the Theban public baths.
